title: Understanding Ionization Energy
text: Ionization energy is the energy required to remove an electron from an atom. It generally increases across a period from left to right and decreases down a group in the periodic table.

title: Identify the Period and Group
text: Locate each element on the periodic table. Determine which period and group each element belongs to. This will help you understand their relative ionization energies.

title: Trends Across a Period
text: As you move from left to right across a period, ionization energy tends to increase. Consider the position of each element in its period.

title: Trends Down a Group
text: As you move down a group, ionization energy tends to decrease. Consider the position of each element in its group.

title: Compare Elements in the Same Period
text: Compare the ionization energies of elements that are in the same period. Which element is further to the right?

title: Compare Elements in Different Groups
text: Compare the ionization energies of elements that are in different groups. Which element is higher up in the group?
